comments:
200406081200

The delete key does not work consistantly in the text editor (or Java editor). 
It will occasionally work, but most of the time it does nothing.

This happens out of the box for me, but only for Java editors:
- new workspace
- new Java project
- new class file
- type something
- place cursor in the middle
- press Delete key
- it has no effect

Doing the same with a plain text file works OK.

In my development workspace, it sometimes works the first time after switching
to a different editor.
I also got an error dialog one time, with the following in the .log:

This is most likely a jface.text problem which was caused by 64832 when they 
added the DELETE operation to the ProjectionViewer.

The problem is the assumption that DELETE is coded to work like CUT/COPY when 
it comes to a 0 length selection.  For delete, a marked region is one 
possibility but when one doesn't exist it should be a delete the character.

I think the behavior of DELETE when there is a marked region shouldn't delete 
the region but still just act like a normal DELETE.  There should be a 
different command to delete a region which is defined by a mark.  Thats the 
way emacs works.
*** Bug 66229 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

DEL fixed in I200406080800.

Nick, do you have any specifics about the situation in which you got the 
exception? How did the selection overlap with a collapsed region?
*** Bug 66262 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
